name: Authorizer
description: Open source authentication and authorization solution for your applications. Bring your database and have complete control over the authentication, authorization and user data.

DATABASE_URL.description: Database URL where you want to save the auth data

DATABASE_TYPE.description: Database type which you want to connect with. Currently supports sqlite, mysql, postgres

ADMIN_SECRET.description: Authorizer admin secret, used to access master data

SMTP_HOST.description: SMTP Host for sending emails for verification

SMTP_PORT.description: SMTP Port used by SMTP host

SENDER_EMAIL.description: Email using which the password should be sent

SENDER_PASSWORD.description: Password for the above mentioned email

JWT_SECRET.description: Random string that will be used for encrypting the JWT token

AUTHORIZER_URL.description: Server URL. For heroku this will Your https://heroku_name.herokuapp.com

FORGOT_PASSWORD_URI.description: URI for the forgot password page in your web application

FACEBOOK_CLIENT_ID.description: Facebook client ID for facebook login

FACEBOOK_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Facebook client secret for facebook login

GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID.description: Google client ID for google login

GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Google client secret for google login

GITHUB_CLIENT_ID.description: Github client ID for github login

GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Github client secret for github login

REDIS_URL.description: Redis URL used for persisting user session. If not configured session will be persisted in memory. Note: In memory sessions will not be persisted across server restart and not recommended for production

DISABLE_EMAIL_VERIFICATION.description: Option to disable email verification during sign up process. This is helpful when you want to test a demo without setting up SMTP. If you set this to false, please configure SMTP env variables. For more information Read docs.

ALLOWED_ORIGINS.description: Whitelist the URL for which this instance of authorizer is allowed

RESET_PASSWORD_URL.description: URL where user is required to be redirected for password change

ROLES.description: Comma separated list of roles that platform supports

PROTECTED_ROLES.description: Comma separated list of protected roles for which sign-up is disabled

DEFAULT_ROLES.description: Default role that should be assigned to user. It should be one from the list of `ROLES` env.

JWT_ROLE_CLAIM.description: JWT key to be used to validate the role field.

ORGANIZATION_NAME.description: Your organization name. Default value is Authorizer. This is used in email and default login page

ORGANIZATION_LOGO.description: Your organization logo. Default is Authorizer logo. This is used in email and default login page.
